greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the largest number whose product of decimal digits equals n^n.
comment: No digit=1 is permitted to avoid infinite number of solutions; a(n)=0 if A067734(n^n)=0.
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..100
formula: a(n) is obtained as prime factors of n^n concatenated in order of magnitude and with repetitions; a(n)=0 if n has p > 7 prime factors.
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Feb 19 2002
ext: a(12) corrected by _Chai Wah Wu_, Aug 12 2017
